results.abstract: He may be considered the ultimate 007, but it took him time to find his footing, helped by a director with a taste for high living.
Whether as James Bond or Indiana Jones’s father, the Scottish star played the man’s man with an earthy sexiness, as these performances prove.
results.title: 15 Sean Connery Movies to Stream

Zoe Lister-Jones on ‘The Craft’ and Women’s Power

multimedia.caption: Often films about teenagers with special powers focus on how overwhelmed they are, Lister-Jones said. “I don’t think that’s a message we need to be giving to young women anymore. I think the more power, the better.”

results.abstract: What’s more fundamental to scary movies than the bone-chilling shriek? But delivering a terrifying wail isn’t easy. It’s an entire art with a history and a world of its own.

Sean Connery, Who Embodied James Bond and More, Dies at 90
results.abstract: To legions of fans who have watched a parade of actors play Agent 007, none played the part as magnetically or as indelibly as Mr. Connery.

How New York’s Small Cinemas Are Hanging On
results.abstract: Despite the continued shutdown of the city’s movie houses, indie theaters just may survive: They are less reliant on Hollywood and have a loyal audience.

multimedia.caption: Nick Nicolaou, who owns Cinema Village, and the people behind indie cinemas like Film Forum, Anthology Film Archives and Nitehawk remain in an uneasy limbo, desperate for audiences yet terrified of cinemas becoming petri dishes.
multimedia.copyright: Calla Kessler for The New York Times
